intro: Banisteria monostyla, commonly known as the delicate banister, is a climbing vine native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent, spurred corona. The fruit is a small, capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
